title: incompatibilidade Hostnet
content:

Aguardo um retorno.
creator: dri.boaventura

title: e-mail doesn't display in containing folder
content:
Hello. I was searching my Inbox for e-mails I knew I had, but they weren't showing up! After doing a general search, I found the e-mails in the search results. Then, I clicked "open in conversation" and they were all there and labeled with "Inbox" or "Sent" folder, respectively. So I right-clicked and selected, "open in containing folder", but it didn't work! The "containing folder" opened [i.e., the Inbox], but didn't show the e-mail! So then I searched manually by scrolling in the Inbox to the date of the "hidden" e-mail -- yet it wasn't there!

(In other words, when I did "open in conversation" from the search results, it showed the conversation, but I can't actually see the e-mails in their containing folder!) Besides for this problem, but I think there are a lot of other e-mails that are "hiding" in this way as well. What should I do?

Thanks for any help you can provide!

Sincerely, Jonathan Rosenberg
creator: slowtoreply

title: changing accounts erases entered message text
content:

The text is gone!
creator: edsnet555

title: Inconsistent delivery of emails
content:
A neighbour and I both use Thunderbird and are both members of a small residents' committee. I have been sending items out using the Thunderbird account linked to my website. Some have received them (not thunderbird users) but others have not. I can write to everyone using a different (gmail) account which also uses Thunderbird, and everyone gets them. The neighbour likewise can write to me direct from her gmail account (ie not using Thunderbird) but not from her main account using Thunderbird. 

I checked on recent updates and restarted the laptop but that made no difference.

That all sounds very confusing and yes I am confused and would welcome some simple advice (I am not an expert!)on where we start to track this down. I suspect we're missing something simple. I hope so! Many thanks Paul
creator: countrycasita

title: Rebuilding Thunderbird without my old profile
content:
My computer of the last few years crashed and will not reboot. I did not manage to copy over my old Thunderbird profile info, so that is now lost.

However, I do have my old pop3 email folders saved in a folder with my other document files.

I'd like to rebuild my Thunderbird email account so I can access all the emails saved in my email folders but am not sure how to go about doing that without my other profile info.

Is this possible? How would I do it?

Huge thanks for any help you can provide.

Greg
creator: gregoryspatz

title: 'Automatically mark messages as read' is disabled but is ignored in Archives
content:
Hello,

in Thunderbird 115.7.0 on Ubuntu 22.04 I have the option 'Automatically mark messages as read' disabled. But this setting is ignored for the foldes in Archive and it´s subfolders regardless of the account. That means this options behaves the same for the folder Archives in every account.

Cheers Mark
creator: Moerkey
